column1: We are a team of architects based in Lisbon, London, and Amsterdam with strong relations in Macau – this makes it easy and practical to arrange meetings, discussions and presentations in all locations.

column1: We are connected by a shared vision of community and an ethical way of working where language and shape are secondary to thought and meaning.
column2: Partilhamos uma visão de comunidade e uma ética de trabalho onde a forma e o desenho são secundários ao pensamento e ao significado.

column1: House in Castelo de Vide, Portugal
column2: Moradia em Castelo de Vide, Portugal

column1: The idea was to build a house that allowed living mainly on the ground floor, while the upper floor could be rented. So the house is composed of two separate levels, communicating by stairs, which can be closed, therefore separating the two worlds. The rotation of the upper plan is ideal for solar panels, which is expressed on the roof fall. All rooms including the bathroom open onto the field, allowing everyone to be independent and the outside to merge with the inside. There was an existing derelict building on site from which the new build borrows the footprint and the stone for the walls. Within the estate there was also build a detached multipurpose small studio.
column2: Uma casa multifamiliar separada em dois pisos sobrepostos a 90 graus unidos somente por uma escada interior. O programa pedia a possibilidade de utilizar a casa como um todo, ou o aluguer do piso de cima. O resultado são dois corpos rodados em que cada um tenta explorar ao máximo a ligação com a rua em dois níveis separados dada a inclinação do terreno. A rotação do piso de cima permitiu a orientação a sul e a cobertura é inclinada para a óptima captação de energia solar. A casa está no mesmo local de uma pré-existência e vive da enraização aos muros do local. Foi também construído um pequeno estúdio no terreno.

column1: Competition: House in Luanda - Patio and Pavillion
column2: Concurso: Casa em Luanda - Pátio e Pavilhão

column1: Credits: Daniela Castel-Branco, Miguel Cordeiro, Beatriz Talavera and Dion Lembekker
column2: Créditos: Daniela Castel-Branco, Miguel Cordeiro, Beatriz Talavera e Dion Lembekker

column1: The 30 years civil war accelerated the rural exodus to Luanda. The lack of infrastructures resulted in the invention of survival strategies. Angolan are resourceful, spending their day selling, buying and storing brick by brick. How to incorporate this reality in our design proposal? How to build a sustainable low budget house in a slum? The single house replication determines different neighbourhood blocks. We propose as house extension a frontage space that can be used for a small shop. This double front face is turned to the street working as a buffer for the house private sphere. The common spaces are central where the family gathers and parties. The patio walls are higher to assure the house cooling. All the materials are sourced locally. The tin roof is recyclable and collects rainwater for the garden and toilet.
column2: Os 30 anos de guerra civil aceleraram o êxodo rural para Luanda. A falta de infraestructuras resultaram na invenção de estratégias de sobrevivência. Os Angolanos são desenrascados, passando o seu dia-a-dia recolhendo, vendendo e armazenando - tijolo a tijolo. Como incorporar esta realidade numa proposta viável? Como construir uma casa sustentável de baixo custo num musseque? A repetição contínua de uma casa determina a variedade de bairros de vizinhança. Propõe-se na entrada da casa uma extensão que pode ser usada como espaço comercial. Esta dupla fachada permite um espaço de pausa para a entrada privada da casa/pátio interior. Os espaços comuns são centrais na vida social/funcional das pessoas. As paredes do pátio são elevadas para potenciar o refrescamento do pátio interior. Todos os materiais são de recursos/produção local. A cobertura de zinco é reciclável e a inclinação das águas permite a recolha da chuva para uso doméstico.

column1: The main body of the building dates from the XV century, but it suffered many changes through the years. This new program required 13 apartments in order to be economically viable. So a new building is added to the existent. The program also asked for parking and a swimming pool, so the result it’s more or less like a private condominium.
column2: O edifício original data do sec. XV, mas sofreu muitas alterações de construção e uso ao longo do tempo. Por necessidade de viabilidade económica o programa exigia a construção de um novo corpo, para que todo o conjunto fosse transformado em apartamentos. Foi usada climatização geotérmica em todo o complexo. O programa também exigia piscina, mini-ginásio, estacionamento e um grande jardim. É um pequeno condomínio.

column1: The exercise was to build a table for two users, husband and wife, with diferent recomendations. He had a good collection of pens, and needed a big surface for he was aparently desorganized, and she needed a big space to store paper and simply drop on the drawers everything she wanted. The result was a composition of two tables, one inside the other, one male and one female... And yes! we tried the IFDA 2002 competition
column2: Pretendia-se o desenho de duas mesas para o uso de um casal, com diferentes requisitos. Ele tinha uma coleção de canetas e necessitava de espaço para a sua aparente desorganização e ela necessitava de espaço de arrumo para largar o que quisesse dentro das gavetas sem preocupação. O resultado foi a composição de duas mesas, uma dentro da outra com módulos de gavetas feminino e masculino	Há! e participámos no concurso IFDA 2002
Cliente: Governo da Provincia da Huíla, Angola (CNS)

column1: Designing the master plan for the Lubango city was one of the richest experiences ever. In a place like Angola, one can never think the work is simply intellectual, it requires all our effort and energy and the simplest things. What we do, the way we work is what we teach and what we leave. It´s very simple, everything counts. Photographing the museum collection, preparing an exhibition about the past, the present and the future of the city made part of this experience in Africa.
column2: O trabalho inerente a um plano director municipal exige a recolha de dados sobre a cidade e a população, experiência essa de grande intensidade dado o volume de trabalho. No caso de uma cidade Angolana essa experiência é tão maior, já que tudo o que fazemos, dizemos e ensinamos sem saber
column3: é útil. Parte dessa experiência passou pelo inventário fotográfico do Museu Regional da Huíla, a preparação de um exposição sobre o passado, presente e futuro da cidade, o desenho do mapa da cidade e uma palestra nos Arquitectos Sem Fronteiras (ASF-Portugal).

column1: The project aims to redevelop an area of 40.500 sqm, formerly occupied by warehouses and factories that have long been obsolete. We propose to sustain the continuity of public squares, which characterize the Lisbon's river front, promoting the physical and visual contact with the river.
column2: O projecto desenvolve-se numa área de 40.500 m2, anteriormente ocupada por armazéns e fábricas há muito desactivadas. Propõe-se com esta solução a continuidade das praças públicas ao longo da frente ribeira de Lisboa potenciando a relação física e visual com o rio Tejo.
XIV Festival Internacional de "BD" da Amadora

column1: Exhibition design for the best Portuguese comic book of the year by José Carlos Fernandes 7x6 m (42 m2) Room The aim is to communicate the ambience of a jazz bar, creating a universe where time and space twisted to give the impression of physical discomfort. The process consisted of using an optic illusion on the floor and stretching the walls to stimulate the experience. Four chairs were also created, attributing to each character of the story one “impersonated” chair.
column2: Layout e construção da exposição para a melhor banda desenhada do ano de José Carlos Fernandes	7x6 m (42 m2) Room. O objectivo era conseguir transmitir espacialmente a sensação de desconforto físico inspirado nos livros "A pior banda do mundo". A resposta foi dada através do uso de um truque de ilusão óptica pintado na quadrícula deformada no chão, dos planos oblíquos das paredes e da inclinação do pavimento. Quatro cadeiras foram criadas no centro da sala personificando através do seu desenho cada um dos músicos.

column1: Refurbishment of a Span house in Blackheath, London
column2: Remodelação de uma "Span house" em Blackheath, Londres

column1: This house belongs to a group of 19 which form Parkend, a Span estate in Blackheath, London. Span estates are residential developments build between the 50s and the 80s across the UK, by a company formed by developers (Geoffrey Townsend and Leslie Bilsby), an architect (Eric Lyons) and a landscape architect (Ivor Cunningham). Set in a suburban area where communal gardens help to create a sense of community, Parkend was originally built in 1967. This house has an ongoing refurbishment plan that includes new hardwood windows with double glazing, in adapted replica of the original design, hardwood external cladding with insulation and roof coverings with added insulation. Apart from the upgraded replica elements, some parts of the project are new additions, as the integrity of the original was lost: entrance door panel and hallway, bathroom, kitchen, bespoke integrated storage units and a new garden design.
Book illustrations for "Personagens para um lugar memorável", by Ana Francisco, Black Sun publishers, Lisbon, 2004
column2: Ilustração do livro de poemas: "Personagens para um lugar memorável", Ana Francisco, Black Sun publishers, Lisboa, 2004

column1: The ruin had to be demolished so the site could be seen in it's full potencial. A new house was built in the same place respecting the pre-existence and opened to the patio. Medieval windows were relocated, and a central heating system was added.
column2: Só após a demolição da ruína, pudémos ver todo o potencial do lugar. Uma nova casa foi construída, sendo acrescentado um corpo em "L" fechando o pátio para a sala. A circulação foi estudada para que o pátio fosse vivido. O alçado a poente - em contacto com a praceta - teve um tratamento destacado para salvaguardar a memória das pré-existências do convento de Tentúgal.Foi adicionado um sistema de aquecimento central através de recuperador e radiadores a água.

column1: The new facilities for Macau's Social Welfare Department - a 16 storey office building in a corner site of 483 sqm. The design approach - revisiting the neoclassical - was part of the client’s brief.
column2: Num gaveto de 483 m2 projectou-se o novo edifício de escritórios para o Instituto de Acção Social de Macau. O desenho, uma visita ao neoclássico, foi um requisito do cliente.

column1: The pattern uses as inspiration typefaces and calligraphy. In this particular case the first letter of the western alphabet. The fabric was firstly conceived as part of my graduation project. Aware of my fashion background the Atom size singer ask me to design “something she could wear on stage” during the band concert/performances. The Stagewear it is an opportunity to recycle thoughts, a bit in the band improvisation mood. It’s composed by two pieces: First the necklace as wearable as any piece of cloth and second a new use for a t-shirt. The result it’s up-side-down wear. A T-shirt transformed into a XL baggy shorts.
column2: The pattern uses as inspiration typefaces and calligraphy. In this particular case the first letter of the western alphabet. The fabric was firstly conceived as part of my graduation project. Aware of my fashion background the Atom size singer ask me to design “something she could wear on stage” during the band concert/performances. The Stagewear it is an opportunity to recycle thoughts, a bit in the band improvisation mood. It’s composed by two pieces: First the necklace as wearable as any piece of clothe and second a new use for a t-shirt. The result it’s up-side-down wear. A T-shirt transformed into a XL baggy shorts.

column1: Futurecycles see informal actions as an opportunity to think globally and to examine urban manifestations which are detached from architecture or urbanism practices. We believe that a research on the unplanned cities will launch clues opposed to urban social pathologies, which can also be found in the planned cities. Once we analyze these informal actions with no prejudgments or presumptions, we hope to unveil a sustainable approach to new urbanity. The intention is to develop a research based on the inherent qualities of informality that can be found in all human settlements, as a universal value.
column2: Futurecycles see informal actions as an opportunity to think globally and to examine urban manifestations which are detached from architecture or urbanism practices. We believe that a research on the unplanned cities will launch clues opposed to urban social pathologies, which can also be found in the planned cities. Once we analyze these informal actions with no prejudgments or presumptions, we hope to unveil a sustainable approach to new urbanity. The intention is to develop a research based on the inherent qualities of informality that can be found in all human settlements, as a universal value.

column1: The idea gathers two distinct materials in a neck accessory. A Laser cutted plexiglas front and a crochet silk back assembled together. Surprisingly, the contrast between the applied techniques enhances the body anatomy. The front is flat and the back softly surrounds the neck.
column2: The idea gathers two distinct materials in a neck accessory. A Laser cutted plexiglas front and a crochet silk back assembled together. Surprisingly, the contrast between the applied techniques enhances the body anatomy. The front is flat and the back softly surrounds the neck.

column1: S4M Skeletons for Mileuristas[Reusing one real estate legacy for a new target group]
column2: S4M Skeletons for Mileuristas[Reusing one real estate legacy for a new target group]

column1: The impact of the Spanish crisis in the European Community is directly proportional to the size (10% of EU area) of the country. The Real Estate speculation left behind 1.2 million vacant legacies* and a demand for 760.000 social homes. These facts and figures are the engine of this research. Why is it necessary to build an additional 760.000 homes while there are 1.2 million already unoccupied standing? Although there is no money to finish these buildings, there is a shortage of affordable housing which could be filled by these vacant legacies. There is a need for urgent action to reuse the Skeletons* as potential structures before they fall into disrepair. They could become future homes for an unconsidered social group known as Mileuristas*, who would finally have access to an affordable dwelling.
column2: The impact of the Spanish crisis in the European Community is directly proportional to the size (10% of EU area) of the country. The Real Estate speculation left behind 1.2 million vacant legacies* and a demand for 760.000 social homes. These facts and figures are the engine of this research. Why is it necessary to build an additional 760.000 homes while there are 1.2 million already unoccupied standing? Although there is no money to finish these buildings, there is a shortage of affordable housing which could be filled by these vacant legacies. There is a need for urgent action to reuse the Skeletons* as potential structures before they fall into disrepair. They could become future homes for an unconsidered social group known as Mileuristas*, who would finally have access to an affordable dwelling.
